snippet: Legalized abortion faces its greatest threat in decades, people on both sides of the issue say, and that includes the possibility that Roe v. Wade will be overturned....
abstract: Donald Trump's presidential victory has emboldened abortion opponents, who have vowed 'onslaught' of pro-life legislation; combatants on both sides of abortion debate see legalized abortion as more threatened than it has been in decades, with looming possibility that Roe v Wade may be overturned.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG
byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Columbus, and Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Legalized abortion faces its greatest threat in decades, people on both sides of the issue say, and that includes the possibility that Roe v. Wade will be overturned.

headline.main: Abortion Foes, Emboldened by Trump, Promise ‘Onslaught’ of Tough Restrictions
headline.print_headline: Emboldened by Trump’s Victory,  Abortion Foes Vow ‘Onslaught’
